commit_msg:
tracing: Have error path in predicate_parse() free its allocated memory

In predicate_parse, there is an error path that is not going to
out_free instead it returns directly which leads to a memory leak.

Link: http://lkml.kernel.org/r/20190920225800.3870-1-navid.emamdoost@gmail.com

Signed-off-by: Navid Emamdoost <navid.emamdoost@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Steven Rostedt (VMware) <rostedt@goodmis.org>
Bug Filter Response:
The patch addresses a memory leak in the error handling of the predicate_parse function, ensuring allocated memory is freed. This prevents resource exhaustion but doesn't fix a security vulnerability.

**Final Classification:** Defect Remediation & Feature Upgrades  
**Confidence Score:** 0.95
